meanings.definition: To divide or distribute something among a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The teacher divvied the candies among the students.
meanings.sent2: The siblings divvied the chores evenly between them.
meanings.sent3: The friends divvied up the pizza slices for a fair share.
meanings.sent4: She divvied her time between work and family like a skilled juggler.
meanings.sent5: The charity divvied the donations to help those in need.

meanings.definition: To share or split something equally.
meanings.sent1: They divvied the cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: The team divvied the prize money among its members.
meanings.sent3: The siblings divvied the last cookie with a playful argument.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility was divvied up like pieces of a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The group divvied the tasks to finish the project on time.

meanings.sent1: The manager divvied the budget for different departments.
meanings.sent2: The committee divvied the resources for the event.
meanings.sent3: The players divvied their energy for the final match.
meanings.sent4: Time was divvied like precious jewels among the attendees.
meanings.sent5: The chef divvied the ingredients for the perfect recipe.
